titleStmt.title: B. W. Foley to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1126

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
Court Room Kenton Cir Court
Covington Ky Sept. 26th 1865
Governor Thos. E Bramlette

Sir, Enclosed I send you a copy of an Indictment now pending in the Kenton Circuit Court agst. Moukedwick & Swire. Information having reached the Police of this city that said Moukedwick is now in the city of St Louis Mo. if your Excellency should deem it expedient to send a Requisition upon the Govenor of Missouri for said Deft. you will please enclose the same to us and we recommend Jeremiah T. Reed a member of the police of this city as a trustworthy & suitable person to conduct said Deft to this city.

Very Respectfully
B W Foley Clerk
By A C Ellis D C

Requisition upon Gov of Missouri for Geo Moukedwick & appointment of Jeremiah Reed agent
28 Sept /65
